instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
Hi all , i have a problem with me macbook pro retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , it turns on and give sound only by holding the power button and then plug the charger in , black screen , fans spins high even low temp . charger looks good from green to orange . 

if it's possible to give me the steps to diagnose would help me really 

thanks,

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
do you get a green light on the charger? if so start checking your power rail.
if not.  Check the pp3v42 rail

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message: Yes green then orange , but when i plug the charger in the mac don;t start up it self i need to hold the power button for 6 7 sec and it starts.

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
Looks like it only starts in SMC bypass.
Post exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

Any history available, liquid signs?

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
No Sir , no liquid , 4 years ago i it just turn the screen black and leaves it in the box ,cuz i thought it is the GPU , so i tried heating a little wih a hair dryer and it turns on for a bit and than again now i want really to know whats te problem just im into learning microsoldering big thanks to louis who insipred me for that. 

So , when i press the power button  and put the charger in by holding the pw button it starts to run and make the welcome sound but also the fans starts to run really fast i dont see any damge on the board . 

So pin 17/18 resistance is 03.90 pin 27/28 is 21.17 . 

what dose this mean ?

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
Please reply with new post, not a comment.

Fan runs at max when start in SMC bypass, is normal.

Do you have original 85W charger?

Check if <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is high level.
ALso check if <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage is present.
Post voltages for <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_CHGR_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
Connect to an working machine and check power in system report.
15" will NOT start with 60W charger; unless the battery is connected and has some charge on it.

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message: i toke out the chip and the charger light is fine , when i put it on it get shortet ? is smth wrong with the u700 chip ? also check email .

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
You will get light even with 45W cable.
But machine doesn't start without 85W charger, if no battery (charged) present...

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message: I?m using a power supply ? Is that a problem ? Idk what watt is the head of the charger should i get a 85w head ? And before i took the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> the mac startup fine in bypass mode just the fans spins fast and the battery was not recognized ? What are the diagnosing steps now ?

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
That is normal behaviour for SMC bypass.
You should check <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage first.
If OK, need to check SMC sensors level.
And yes, head cable must be 85W...

threads.message: I accidentally touched <CAPACITOR>C7016</CAPACITOR> with <CAPACITOR>C7002</CAPACITOR> with the prob by measuring the voltage ! now i dont have pp3v42 ? can't find the burning cap ? replaced <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> , <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> still now power ?

threads.message:

<CHIP>U6990</CHIP> voltages?

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
No nowhere ! 100mv voltage 
Diode mode 00.33 somwhere 600.00 somewhere 00.80 
<CHIP>U6990</CHIP> :
pin 2 104mv
pin 3 1v
pin 4 250mv
pin 5 700mv
pin 6 17.45v

and for diode mode where exactly to touch ? soory im new in this ,thats why this dumb questions .

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
You must check diode mode at L6995; usually aprox 0.300, red probe at ground.
If big difference, lift one pin and see where the lower value remains.

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message: I?m getting a shortt on <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> replaced it 3 times still gets really hot ? Where to check !

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
So you change and power up the board directly?
No previous measures in diode mode???

Post diode mode at L7030 and check <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> for short.

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
L6695 = right pin 0.333 , left pin 0.000 
L7030 = both sides 0.450 
<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is shorted i think. i removed it .
where to check now ? or to inject voltage to find the short ?

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
"L6695 = right pin 0.333 , left pin 0.000"
No way to know how you look at the board; you may look in schematic, or boardview in different way.
That coil has pins 1 and 2 marked on the schematic; please post accurate infoormation.
I suppose you got different ohm values because coil is lifted...

"<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> is shorted i think. i removed it ."
Why don't measure it, once removed?

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message: On L6695 pin2 = 0.000 pin1 = 0.325 those values are with lifted coil . should i put <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and then check for short i can i do it without ?

threads.title: MB pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , black screen , fan spins crazy .
threads.message:
You have short on <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> rail.
<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and SMC are suspect, but more chips are connected there.
You can try to inject voltage (carefully)...

?

threads.message: If that screw holes is busted, you're going to have other issues once you fix the power issue just forewarning you...
